events.description: This is a market on whether any of the first 10 picks in the first round of the 2021 NFL draft will be traded during the NFL draft, currently scheduled for April 29, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if an official trade of one of the first 10 picks in the 2021 NFL draft from one team to another is announced, at any time after the team with the 1st overall pick goes on the clock to any time before the team with the 11th overall pick goes on the clock. This market will resolve “No” otherwise. The resolution source for this market will be the live broadcast of the NFL draft, as well as credible news reports of a trade taking place or press releases or any official announcement from the NFL or an NFL team’s official representatives. This market will resolve after the team with the 11th pick in the NFL draft goes on the clock. If the NFL draft is delayed, this market will be delayed until the NFL Draft takes place. If the NFL draft still has not taken place by June 1, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.
events.title: Will any of the first 10 picks in the NFL draft be traded during the draft?

events.description:
In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never happened before in a sport or league's history. 

In NFL's history, there have been 1070 unique scores. 
The most recent Scorigami for an NFL game occurred on November 21, 2021, when the Indianapolis Colts defeated the Buffalo Bills by a score of 41–15.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one more NFL Scorigami will occur after the market inception date, November 22, 8 AM ET, and before the market resolution time, November 30, 11:00 PM ET.
Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is an official NFL website (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis will be helpful (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami)
events.title: Will there be another (1071st) NFL Scorigami in November 2021?

events.description:
The NFL 2021-22 season will conclude with Super Bowl LVI, the league's championship game. 

It will be played between the National Football Conference (NFC) champion Los Angeles Rams and the American Football Conference (AFC) champion Cincinnati Bengals on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.

This market will resolve to "Rams" if Los Angeles Rams become the NFL 2021-22 champions, and to "Bengals" if Cincinnati Bengals become the NFL 2021-22 champions.

If for any reason the winner is not decided by February 20 2022, this market will resolve 50-50.
events.title: Superbowl LVI: Who will win Rams v. Bengals?

events.description:
This is a market on whether quarterback Thomas Edward Patrick Brady Jr. will play for any team during the first week of the 2022 football season, the 103rd season of the National Football League (NFL). If Tom Brady plays in the first week of the 103rd NFL season with any team, this market will resolve to “Yes”. Otherwise this market will resolve to “No”. Note that preseason games will not count, only Week 1 games will count.

events.description:
This is the market on the time length of the U.S. National Anthem ("The Star-Spangled Banner"), performed at the NFL Superbowl XVI, scheduled for February 13 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California. 

This market will resolve to "Yes", if the National Anthem at the Superbowl XVI lasts more than 100:000 seconds, as verified by the broadcast and recordings. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No". For example, if it lasts 100 seconds and 1 millisecond, the market will resolve to "Yes."

The time used to resolve this market begins when the singer begins to sing, not when the music starts to play. The timing ends when the singer is finished singing the word “brave,” no matter how long they hold that note.

If for any reason, the performance or the Superbowl does not happen by February 15 (11:00 PM ET), this market will resolve to "No".
events.title: Will the National Anthem at the Superbowl LVI be longer than 100 seconds?

In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never happened before in a sport or league's history. 

In NFL's history, there have been 1069 unique scores. The most recent Scorigami for an NFL game occurred on November 4, 2021, when the Indianapolis Colts defeated the New York Jets by a score of 45–30.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one more NFL Scorigami will occur after the market inception date, November 15, 2 PM ET, and before the market resolution time, November 30, 12:00 PM ET.
Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is an official NFL website (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis will be helpful (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami)

events.description:
The NFL 2021-22 season will conclude with Super Bowl LVI, the league's championship game. It will be played between the National Football Conference (NFC) champion Los Angeles Rams and the American Football Conference (AFC) champion Cincinnati Bengals on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.

This market is about the total final point difference in the Superbowl LVI game, including overtime.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the point difference is greater than 5.5. This market will resolve to "No" if the point difference is less than 5.5.

---------------------

Please note, the point difference is the absolute difference between points counted for each of the teams at the end of the game (including overtime).

For example, if the final score is 9:1, 11:3, 7:15... - then the point difference equals 8;
if the final score is 13:11, 22:20, 12:14... - then the point difference equals 2, etc...
events.title: Superbowl LVI: Will the point difference be greater than 5.5?

events.description:
In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never happened before in a sport or league's history. 

In NFL's history, there have been 1070 unique scores. 

The most recent (as of November 29) Scorigami for an NFL game occurred on November 21, 2021, when the Indianapolis Colts defeated the Buffalo Bills by a score of 41–15.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one more NFL Scorigami will occur between December 1, 12:00:01 AM ET, and before the market resolution time, December 31, 11:59 PM ET.
Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is an official NFL website (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis will be helpful (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami)
events.title: Will there be an NFL Scorigami in December 2021?

events.description: This is a market on whether more games in Week 1 of the 2021 NFL Preseason will be won by teams in the AFC or in the NFC. For the purposes of this market, games for the 2021 NFL Preseason Week 1 will consist only of those NFL preseason games played between Thursday, August 12, 2021 and Sunday, August 15, 2021, inclusive. This market will resolve to "AFC" if, excluding intra-conference games (i.e., games between two AFC teams or between two NFC teams), teams in the AFC win more games in the NFL's Preseason Week 1 than teams in the NFC do. This market will resolve to "NFC" if, excluding intra-conference games, teams in the NFC win more games in the NFL's Preseason Week 1 than teams in the AFC do. This market will resolve 50/50 if, excluding intra-conference games, teams in the AFC and teams in the NFC win the same number of games. Membership in the AFC or NFC is determined according to the conference listings on the NFL webpage at: https://www.nfl.com/teams/. A current listing of games scheduled for NFL Preseason Week 1 is available on the NFL webpage at: https://www.nfl.com/schedules/ by selecting "2021" and "Preseason Week 1" from the drop-down menus. If a game currently listed on that schedule is rescheduled to a date after August 15, 2021, it will not be counted for the purposes of this market. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).
events.title: Will teams from the AFC or NFC win more games in the 2021 NFL Preseason Week 1?

events.description:
In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never happened before in a sport or league's history. 

In NFL's history, there have been 1071 unique scores. 

The most recent (as of December 15) Scorigami for an NFL game occurred on December 12 2021, when the Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Las Vegas Raiders by a score of 48–9.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one more NFL Scorigami will occur between December 17, 12:00:01 AM ET, and before the market resolution time, December 31, 11:59 PM ET.
Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is an official NFL website (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis will be helpful (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami)
events.title: Will there be another (1072nd) NFL Scorigami in December 2021?

events.description:
This is a market group on the first round of 2021–22 National Football League playoffs,  dubbed the wild-card playoffs or wild-card weekend.

Currently, seven teams from each of the league's two conferences qualify for the playoffs. A tie-breaking procedure exists if required. 

In wildcard playoffs, the second-seeded division winner hosts the seventh seed wild card, the third seed hosts the sixth seed, and the fourth seed hosts the fifth seed. 

The tournament culminates in the Super Bowl LVI on February 13, in which two teams, one from each conference, play each other to become champion of the NFL.
events.title: NFL: 2021–22 Wildcard playoffs

events.description:
This is a market group on the second round of 2021–22 National Football League playoffs, dubbed the divisional playoffs.

In the Divisional round, which is scheduled for the weekend of January 22–23, the top seed in the conference will play the lowest remaining seed and the other two remaining teams will play each other. The winners of those games will advance to the Conference Championships, which are scheduled to be played on January 30.

The tournament culminates in the Super Bowl LVI on February 13, in which two teams, one from each conference, play each other to become champion of the NFL.
events.title: NFL: 2021–22 Divisional playoffs

events.description:
The National Football League Draft, also called the NFL Draft or (officially) the Player Selection Meeting, is an annual event which serves as the league's most common source of player recruitment. Each team is given a position in the drafting order in reverse order relative to its record in the previous year, which means that the last place team is positioned first and the Super Bowl champion is last. From this position, the team can either select a player or trade its position to another team for other draft positions, a player or players, or any combination thereof. The round is complete when each team has either selected a player or traded its position in the draft. The first draft was held in 1936, and has been held every year since.

The 2022 NFL Draft, the 87th edition of the National Football League's annual draft, is scheduled to be held April 28–30, 2022, at Caesars Forum on the Las Vegas Strip, in Paradise, Nevada.
events.title: 2022 NFL Draft

events.description:
This is a scalar market on the point spread of the final score (not including overtime) of NFL Super Bowl 55. To resolve, at the end of regulation time, the losing team's score can be subtracted from the winning team's score, and the difference will be the resolution of this market. In the event of a tie, and subsequent overtime, this market will resolve to 0.

The lower bound for this market is 0 points, and the upper bound is 14 points. You can use the calculator to the right (underneath the Buy modal) to calculate how each Long or Short Token price corresponds with points spread. Long and Short shares will settle proportionally to the outcome value if the final value is between these bounds, but if the final value exceeds either the upper or lower bound, the price of each Outcome Token is capped at $1 and $0. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

In the event of any postponement of the Super Bowl, this market will not be resolved until the game is played.
events.title: What will the final score points spread be for Super Bowl 55?

In the event this match ends in a tie, post overtime, the market will resolve at 50/50, meaning Titans and Ravens shares will both be redeemable for $.50. If the game is postponed, the same rules will apply for whenever the match is played, until February 1st 2021, when it was resolve 50:50. Results of this market will be decided by official scores available on https://www.nfl.com/.
events.title: Will the Titans or the Ravens win their January 10th NFL Wild Card matchup?

events.description:
In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never before occurred in a sport's or league's history.   

In the National Football League's (NFL's) history, there have been 1072 unique scores. The most recent Scorigami for an NFL game on January 8, 2022, when the Dallas Cowboys defeated the Philadelphia Eagles by a score of 51–26.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one NFL Scorigami occurs between September 1 and September 30, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market may resolve to "No" once all scheduled NFL games within this market's timeframe have been completed and none resulted in a new Scorigami.

The primary resolution source for this market is official information from the NFL (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis may be used (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami).
events.title: Will there be a new (1,073rd) NFL Scorigami in September 2022?
